attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Gordon

I have a suggestion regarding the unpopular abolition of the 10% starting rate.

You already have made a welcome concession for pensioners – i.e. the Personal Allowance for people aged 65-74.

This has a limit of £21,800 for the current tax year, and helps anyone in my age group whose income is modest. 

Why not apply this allowance to everyone?

Obviously it will not affect higher earners, but will allow relief to a group of people, such as many NHS and Local government workers who in many cases perform valuable public service for low rewards.

This would enable you to resolve this issue simply, and to silence the vocal hypocrites of the Opposition.

Please let me know what you think.

Best regards

Bernard Durkan

rejection.details:
Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
Also similar to http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/10penceband/
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
